content: @Grahame Grieve @Lloyd McKenzie I've applied all necessary changes for tracker item FHIR-20839, FHIR-20843, FHIR-20849. I'm starting to implement a R5 version of the .NET engine and didn't wanted to carry over these old burdens. If I could get permissions, I could prepare a PR so these issues get fixed in the current build. Let me know if you would like that. If yes, I could offer to see if I'm able to apply some of the other open changes to StructureMap.

sure that would be good to make a PR. If you make it in the next 2-3 hours, it can make it in the connectation build of FHIR I am releasing today (though it would mainly be for documentation purposes)
Sounds good, the branches are ready for review
What's the process to get permissions to open a PR on the repository?

It's getting late here, so I guess I'll try again for the next connectathon build ;)
https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/FHIR+Build+Process#FHIRBuildProcess-Setup seems to indicate that some sort of formal email is necessary to ask for approval, where should I sent it to? Or is a message here enough?
My GitHub username would be "alexzautke" in any case.
you can always open a PR with no permissions
just make the PR from your own repository

I've started to apply changes for JIRA tickets which would influence either the grammar of the mapping language or the structure of StructureMap. A couple of PRs are now open. Would someone be up for a review?

https://github.com/HL7/fhir/pull/985 - J#20844
https://github.com/HL7/fhir/pull/986 - J#20841
https://github.com/HL7/fhir/pull/984 - J#20848, J#20840
https://github.com/HL7/fhir/pull/1241 - J#20842

Also here a few easy documentation fixes:
https://github.com/HL7/fhir/pull/1242 - J#28465
https://github.com/HL7/fhir/pull/1243 - J#25286
https://github.com/HL7/fhir/pull/1244 - J#23936
